project.teaser: The iAMP-Hydro project will improve the digital operation of existing plants through the development of 6 expected results (R) which will collectively form iAMP - a novel intelligent Asset Management Platform (see result R5 in Fig. 1) encompassing secure open and transparent...
project.objective:
The iAMP-Hydro project will improve the digital operation of existing plants through the development of 6 expected results (R) which will collectively form iAMP - a novel intelligent Asset Management Platform (see result R5 in Fig. 1) encompassing secure open and transparent data sharing protocols (R4) and three novel digital solutions: R1. Condition monitoring and predictive maintenance modelling; R2. Ecological status monitoring and water management; R3. Improved weather and flow forecasting. The full package of digital solutions will be validated at a diverse set of five real-world existing hydropower plants producing evidence for policy making to support the green and digital transition of hydropower (R6). The existing plants include differing power capacities, electro-mechanical equipment type, water end-use, flow and head regimes, climatic conditions, and environmental sensitivities (biodiversity).
The project will increase the technology competitiveness of existing hydro by reducing O&M costs by 5-10%, improving generation and revenues, increasing flexibility and data-driven decision making in hydropower operations. It will also increase the market penetration of renewables in the grid by 8.4 TWh, and getting closer to the EU 2030 Climate and Energy targets, and EU green deal. iAMP-Hydro will improve environmental and socio-economic sustainability of the existing hydropower fleet by reducing operating costs by €1 billion per annum, reducing CO2 emissions by 1260 tonnes, creating 10,000 future-proof jobs, and enabling environmentally sustainable flow regulation using digital solutions.
The project will advance the scientific basis for hydropower digitalization by developing, validating and providing a roadmap for the further development of 5 new digital technologies. We will produce 10 peer reviewed journal publications and 20 conference publications.
project.title: intelligent Asset Management Platform for Hydropower operation and maintenance
project.keywords: hydropower, digital solutions, artificial intelligence, predictive maintenance, sensors, data

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Report outlining the data management processes and standard operating procedures to be used in the project including open science practices

result.title: COP portal with site data & supporting case study documents
result.description: Community of Practice (COP) dedicated portal activited on iAMP-Hydro website containing data from the five validation sites for COP members to access and supporting case study data from other locations from WP6 & 7

result.title: PDEC: Communication Activities, Tools & Resources
result.description: Plan for dissemination, exploitation and communication (PDEC) including: Identification of target audience; Definition of objectives and stakeholders’ interests; Tailoring communication channels and tools; Outlining knowledge management and transfer plans; Outline IP protection strategy and IPR management; Defining impact pathways. PDEC to be evaluated against KPIs in in Table 2.2.1.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - iAMP-Hydro (intelligent Asset Management Platform for Hydropower operation and maintenance)
result.teaser: The EU electricity sector is undergoing a fundamental change with the increase of the digitalisation of energy systems and the increase in intermittent renewable sources. As a result, these systems are more deeply monitored, and artificial intelligence and big-data are...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: hydro and energy data modelling landscape analysis
result.description: Report outlining the analysis of existing standards-based data models and definition of modelling needs to address the data available in the project. It will focus on selecting appropriate standards-based data models and concepts to be included in the project's Data Model while defining data modelling gaps that need to be further elaborated in the project.

result.title: Policy & Regulations Analysis
result.description: Report on estimation of the potential and challenges existing for the exploitation of iAMP-Hydro digital solutions. Conducted for the partner countries and key international markets (one country from Africa, Latin America & Central Asia). Report will include: legal and regulatory framework conditions; survey on regional and national strategies, plans, policy objectives, implemented/planned measures and instruments, related to hydro digitalisation.

result.title: Platform architecture designed and released
result.description: Report on design of the iAMP-Hydro ICT components architecture, including: definition of use cases and user requirements; Conceptual architecture design; Components functional and technical specifications; and Design of individual components

result.title: Site Evaluation Plan and Preparation Activities Report
result.description: Report on definition of a verification and validation framework to measure the project’s technical maturity and the results achieved in the different test sites. Specific validation scenarios will be defined with sub-groups of KPIs to properly address specificities of each site. The validation framework will also focus on defining additional KPIs (technical,economic, environmental and social) to enable a holistic assessment of the project impact per validation site. Preparation activities for planning the launch of the validation activities will also be outlined in this report.

category.title: hydroelectricity

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
